intro: Navarretia havardii, commonly known as the Havard's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It has small, linear leaves and produces numerous flowers that are usually white or pale blue in color. Navarretia havardii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
